titleproper.value:
Guide to the Springfield Cooperative Society Records
                    <num>TAM.045</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T17:04-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Springfield Cooperative Society, founded in 1911, was a consumer cooperative for the purchase of clothing, coal, and groceries. Fragmentary records found here are constitutions, correspondence, financial records, minutes of board of directors meetings, and stock certificates.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Springfield Cooperative Society (Springfield, Mass.) Records; Tamiment #45; box number; folder number; 
                <address>
                    <addressline>New York University Libraries ;</addressline>
                    <addressline>New York University Libraries</addressline>
                </address>
The Springfield Cooperative Society (Springfield, Mass.), founded in 1911, was a consumer cooperative for the purchase of clothing, coal, and groceries.
The collection contains fragmentary records, including constitutions, correspondence, financial records, minutes of board of directors meetings, and stock certificates.
